author: Brian Carlström
comment: The only thing that does not work for me is the black and white mode. Otherwise this watchface is literally genious.  Also it would be great with a better mintue indicator. If that could be done! Just like the orignal has.

reply.author: Insanity On A Bun Software
reply.content: Thanks for the review! Please send an email to contact@ioabsoftware.com so I can try to resolve your issues better.

author: Chauncey Stangle
comment: This watch face captures the spirit of majoras mask perfectly.Works great on my motto 360. I don't know why anyone would complain about hour markers just go off the minute markers. Any semi-intellgent being can read it just fine. It would be cool to see the new interactive abilities the latest android wear update added utilized here but it's perfect as is.
title: Exactly what I was looking for!

author: Layton Schindler
comment: I love the idea of the Termina clock, especially a functional one and not just a picture of the clock. It's the first thing I looked up, but I have a Gear S2 and it's not showing up on my watch faces. Will it ever be available for Tizen/Samsung Gear? 5 stars if so, great stuff!
title: Will it be available for Samsung Gear?

author: Lee Emnesia
comment: It breaks my heart to say that its not working on my sw2 wont even appear in smart connect, i was looking so forward to this. However i know it is amazing and i love the idea so I'll give you 4 stars but please fix this for my watch :)
title: Oh no

author: Daniel Salas
comment: I have a Note 5 and Galaxy S2 Watch. I read that I should wait for the face to pop up in the Gear Wear app but I've been waiting for about 2 days now and it never appreared. I'm disappointed, but I hope you can fix this sometime soon.
title: It's a great idea, I just wished it worked for me

author: Dylan Leigh
comment: It's a little hard to read. The only thing that would make this watch face even better would be the option to have hour markers on the face, if that gets implemented it will be 5 stars through and through!
title: An amazing watch face except...

author: Nicholas Morris
comment: It didn't work on my watch... I bought it, and it doesn't show up when I select a face on either the watch or the wear app. I have a Note 4 paired with a Moto 360.

reply.author: Insanity On A Bun Software
reply.content: It can take up to 5 minutes for an app or watch face to be fully transferred and installed from the phone to the watch. Currently there is no progress indicator for this in Android. Please be patient.

author: Andrew Small
comment: If you love Majora's Mask, or really, if you love The Legend of Zelda, this is a must have. Works perfectly, tells time accurately (though hard to do at a glance), and runs exactly like the Clock Town clock in the game. Suggestion: possibly add a way to tap somewhere and get the day/clock display from the game on top for at a glance viewing? Otherwise, perfect.

reply.author: Insanity On A Bun Software
reply.content: This is something that I have been considering toying with lately. Something like this may make it into a future update!

title: Best watch face for any Zelda fan

author: James McDonagh
comment: A nice and subtle(ish) reference to my favourite Zelda game. I had a watchmaker premium version of this, but I prefer this standalone version. The ambient screen is a nice touch too. It also has the added benefit of keeping the time a secret from others as nobody knows how to read it.
title: Perfect

author: Ryan Huffman
comment: Everything works and looks great on Lg G Watch R! Love it.....any other content from zelda would be great. Thanks
title: Great watchface

author: Tyrion Kenway Wrynn
comment: I love this so much. It feels kinda cool to know I'm pretty much the only person that can read my watch.
title: Amazing

author: malice Barbosa
comment: Looks snazzy on my moto 360. Easy to read and nice to look at. No issues so far
title: Great choice

author: TheExtreme_GameHunter
comment: I love this a lot when, I first bought it in was amazed :)

author: Shaun Cruz
comment: Looks awesome and works great!

author: Adam Taylor
comment: How does this work?

reply.author: Insanity On A Bun Software
reply.content: The red icon on the outer ring shows the position the minute hand would point to on a regular analog clock. The red icon on the center disc, opposite the sun / moon, points to the same position the hour hand on a regular analog clock would. The sun / moon disc shows as a moon between 6:00 PM and 5:59 AM. The time in the screenshots is exactly noon.

title: Noon

author: Lucas N
comment: I have been looking so long for a mm clock. But it is called termina not terminal.

reply.author: Insanity On A Bun Software
reply.content:
I'm aware, Terminal was the working title of the project :)
It'll get fixed in the next release.

title: THANK YOU

author: David Dubuque
comment: I know the design of the clock was never really intended for time in the game, but no helper or anything??? Even if it's a tiny digital clock in a corner.  I mean a watch does tell time after all. Only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because it's an actual moving click from Termina

reply.author: Insanity On A Bun Software
reply.content: This is something I've thought about for a long time, as the original intention of the watch face was to be very true to the clock tower itself. Lately I have been toying with the idea of a digital overlay, or "helper hands" that users can turn on if desired. This may make it to a future update!

title: Can't read it...

author: Michael Kerrigan
comment: Purchased the app. Set it as my watch face, and it instantly crashed.

reply.author: Insanity On A Bun Software
reply.content: Apologies for the bad experience! The watch face has had several updates since this review was posted in late 2015. If you would be willing to give the watch face another try, I'd definitely appreciate it!

title: Very disappointed. Didn't work on my watch.

author: Stephen Eisenhauer
comment: Really cool. Only wish it had an option to make the outer ring act as the second hand so it look busier like in the game.

reply.author: Insanity On A Bun Software
reply.content: The outer ring in the game actually acted as the minute hand, due to the sped-up in-game time it happened to tick roughly once a second.

author: Dillon Stanco
comment: Waited a good half an hour, but it never came up. :[
title: Wanted it to work, but it never showed.
